description: The man's left arm moves back toward his torso.
The man's right arm moves back toward his torso.
The man's left leg is pressed down against the ground while spread wide.
The man's right leg is pressed down against the ground while spread wide.
The man's spine maintains an upright position during the motion.
The woman's left arm is extended straight out to the side.
The woman's right arm is extended straight out to the side.
The woman's left leg is bent slightly at the knee during the landing.
The woman's right leg is bent slightly at the knee during the landing.
The woman's spine is upright and slightly leaned forward during the hop.
The man's left arm is swung downward then raised outward to assist in spinning.
The man's right arm is swung downward then lifted outward to maintain momentum in the spin.
The man's left leg is bent at the knee as he prepares to push off the ground.
The man's right leg is bent at the knee and then extends explosively as he jumps into the air.
The man's spine rotates in coordination with his torso as he spins mid-air.
The man's left arm moves forward in a straight line, keeping the elbow slightly bent.
The man's right arm moves forward in a straight line, keeping the elbow slightly bent.
The man's left leg shifts forward, keeping the knee bent and foot close to the ground.
The man's right leg shifts forward, keeping the knee bent and foot close to the ground.
The man's spine maintains a straight posture, supported by his arms and legs.
The dancer's left arm extends outward at shoulder height.
The dancer's right arm moves to a rounded position above the head.
The dancer's left leg is extended gracefully to the side.
The dancer's right leg pivots strongly on the ball of the foot.
The dancer's spine rotates smoothly in alignment with the torso.
The student's left arm is positioned straight and supporting the body beneath the shoulder.
The student's right arm is straightened along the side of the body or off the ground.
The student's left leg is extended straight back, lying flat on the ground.
The student's right leg is extended straight back along the same plane as the left leg.
The student's spine is maintained in a straight line from the head to the heels.

The man's right arm is raised above his head with the elbow slightly bent.
The man's left leg is planted firmly on the ground, providing stability.
The man's right leg is planted firmly on the ground, providing stability.
The man's spine is maintained in an upright position throughout the movement.

The man's right arm is extended forward, propelling his body as he crawls.

The man's right leg is bent at the knee and positioned on the ground.
The man's spine is flexed to lower his torso toward the ground.
The man's left arm pumps backward from the shoulder in a rapid motion.
The man's right arm pumps forward from the shoulder in a swift motion.
The man's left leg strides forward with a powerful push off the ground.
The man's right leg strides forward while lifting off the ground.
The man's spine leans slightly forward to maintain a low center of gravity.
The man's left arm is extended forward, parallel to the ground.
The man's right arm is positioned at his side, steady and relaxed.
The man's left leg is lifted off the ground, held straight and extended forward.
The man's right leg is bent at the knee as he lowers his body into the squat.
The man's spine is upright and engages to maintain balance throughout the movement.
The man's left arm pulls back with the elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
The man's right arm pulls back in a mirrored motion to the left arm, also bent at the elbow.
The man's left leg extends fully straight after bending at the knee.
The man's right leg mirrors the left leg by extending fully straight after bending at the knee.
The man's spine leans slightly forward at the hips, maintaining an upright position.

The woman's right arm extends sideways horizontally to shoulder height.
The woman's left leg is slightly bent at the knee as she propels herself upward.
The woman's right leg is slightly bent at the knee as she propels herself upward.
The woman's spine is straightened upward during the jump and slightly relaxes as she lands.

The man's right arm is extended upward during the jump.

The man's right leg is bent at the knee and tucked in during the spin.
The man's spine rotates around the vertical axis as he spins.

The man's right arm shifts forward in a straight line, keeping the elbow slightly bent.

The man's right arm pulls back in a rowing motion, bending at the elbow and positioning close to his body.

The man's right leg pushes down into the ground and slightly extends.
